intro: Callitriche obtusangula f. terrestris, commonly known as the terrestrial water-starwort, is a low-growing aquatic plant that thrives in shallow, freshwater environments. It has small, rounded leaves that are typically arranged in whorls around the stem. The plant produces tiny, white flowers that are often submerged or floating, contributing to its ecological role in water ecosystems. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae, characterized by its rapid growth and ability to colonize various wetland habitats. This variety is distinguished by its terrestrial growth habit compared to other forms of the species.
